passage_text: Insert a meat thermometer into the center of the roast, then place it into the oven and heat for 15 minutes. Victor Holguin/Demand Media. Lower the oven temperature to 325 degrees and heat the sirloin tip roast for an additional 28 to 30 minutes per pound. The brief high temperature will give the roast a flavorful, golden outer coating. Sirloin tip roast is a piece of beef cut from the cow’s hind section. It is a large, thick cut that contains a lot of connective tissue and not much fat. The meat can lack flavor and moisture due to its low fat content.

I have a 3 pound tri tip sirloin from Costco and the directions say to cook it in a 425 degree oven until an internal temp of 140, but I don't have a meat thermometer, but even if I did have one, it would have been convenient to know the apprx cooking time. Sear the meat in the roasting pan on top of the stove then finish roasting in a 425 degree oven for about 45 minutes. Let the roast rest for 15 minutes before slicing to allow the juices to redistribute and for an evenly cooked roast.

.. Restaurants and meat purveyors that specialize in medium-rare cuts of Top Sirloin slow roast at temperatures of 170-215* for up to 20 hours. The general rule is about 20-25 minutes per pound @ 225 for rare to medium-rare, but I find you usually have a little more leeway without fear of over-cooking. Cook's Illustrated considers Sirloin Top Butt/Tip Roast to be the poor man's Prime Rib. Slow roasting is how companies like Boar's Head and Thumann's prepare their deli meats ....usually for 8-10 hours @215-225*.
